homeDate: Every Saturday (May through October) from 9:00 am until noon.

body.starting: The Midland Community Farmers Market is operated as a non-profit function of the Mens' Club of Midland United Methodist Church, and is offered as a service to the people of the Midland area of Georgia's Muscogee and Harris Counties. All vendor fees go to support the club's local outreach ministries, including
body.ending: . Come on out and have a good time while supporting your community. SEE YOU THERE!

subtext.subtext1: The weekly fee is as little as $10 (the minimum donation) with no contracts, no big investment, and no long-term commitments. You only pay on the weeks you decide to come sell. There is no charge for Boy Scouts or Girl Scouts, children 13 and under, members of Midland United Methodist Church, charitable groups, or anyone whose sales are a fund-raiser for a charitable purpose.
subtext.subtext2: Your fees go to support deserving local charities selected by the membership of the Men's Club of Midland United Methodist Church.

item2.title: What can I sell at the market?

subtext.subtext1: All kinds of things, as long as it's something YOU or your family have made.
subtext.subtext2: We especially like to see locally-grown produce, but our vendors also have also had good results selling fresh eggs, homemade cheese and other dairy items, pickles and relishes, jams and jellies, local honey, yard and garden plants, cut flowers, fresh bread and other baked goods, birdhouses, picnic tables, walking sticks and canes, toys and other folk art, quilts, crocheting, and other fabric crafts, soaps, candles, and much more.

subtext.subtext1: Don't worry, we don't restrict what you sell on a "somebody's already selling that" basis. Nothing inappropriate, of course, but remember, this is a showcase for your homemade items. So...

subtext2.option1: No resale: items you just bought elsewhere
subtext2.option2: No franchise sales: (Scentsi, Paparazzi, LuLarue, Avon, Tupperware, and Color Street, etc.)
subtext2.option3: No "yard sale" or flea market type items

subtext.subtext3: But if you're not sure, just send us an email.

item4.title: What do I need to do?

subtext.subtext1: If possible, send an email before your first time (see the "Contact" section) so we can get your contact information and answer any questions you might have. Aside from that, you just show up about 8:30 on the Saturdays when you want to sell, set up your table or tent, and get ready to greet your customers!
subtext.subtext2: You're going to like the relaxed, casual atmosphere of the Midland Community Farmers Market. Selling here is a great way to spend a Saturday morning while supporting your community, making a little money, and meeting some wonderful new friends!

contact.contactAddressSub: (the corner of Warm Springs and Garrett Roads)
contact.contactFromColumbus: Head east on Manchester Expressway (north GA-85 / US-27 Alt.) Take the County Line Road exit, and turn left across the bridge. Go a quarter mile and turn right onto Garrett Road.
contact.contactFromWarmSprings: Head south on GA-85. Go four miles past Ellerslie, turn right at the County Line Road exit, and right again at Garrett Road.

weeklyMarket.weeklyMarketExplanation: Reservation can be made beginning at 8:00 PM on the Monday before the market, until 8:00 PM on the Thursday before Saturday's market.

weeklyMarketWriteUp.paragraph1: Our main market filed has 74 spaces. The Market Manager can be found in Space #1. Spaces 2-33 may be reserved for the following Saturday's market. Spaces 23-34 have LIMITED electrical capacity. Simply make your selection from the list of available spaces, and you can pay via credit card or PayPal. These reservations will be held until 8:30 on Saturday morning. After that time, your space may not be available, but your donation may be credited for the use of any other space. Space fee donations are NON-REFUNDABLE. Your $10 fee is a donation to the MUMC Men's Club, which distributes the collected fees to deserving local charities.
weeklyMarketWriteUp.paragraph2: Spaces which were not reserved, and all other spaces, also cost $10 (although we'll happily accept larger donations.) Just show up, pick out a spot, and set up. Payment for these spaces (CASH ONLY) maybe be made on the morning of the market; see the market manager in Space #1.
weeklyMarketWriteUp.paragraph3: Spaces 64 and 71-74 are for overflow use only, after all other spaces are filled. Spaces 67T - 70T are half-size spaces which accommodate tables only, no canopies. See below for parking information.

specialEvent.specialEventExplanation: Reservation can be made beginning six weeks before the event, until the Tuesday before the market.

specialEventWriteUp.paragraph1: Our main market filed has 74 spaces. Space 23-34 have LIMITED electrical capacity. There are an additional 11 spaces by the fountain across the street, and 17 more in the front of the Fellowship Hall. The Market Manager can be found in Space #1. For special market events, ALL SPACES ARE BY RESERVATION ONLY, and may be reserved beginning six weeks before the event, with reservations closing on the Thursday prior to the event. Simply make your selection from the list of available spaces, and you can pay via credit card or PayPal.
specialEventWriteUp.paragraph2: When making your selection, please note that spaces 67T - 70T on the main filed and spaces FH 14T - FH 17T in front of the Fellowship Hall are TABLE ONLY spaces, which can accommodate TABLES ONLY, and do NOT have room for a canopy.
specialEventWriteUp.paragraph3: Please see below for parking information.
specialEventWriteUp.paragraph4: DO NOT DRIVE STAKES at the Fountain or Fellowship Hall spaces. Vendors who violate this rule will be expected to reimburse the church for any resulting damages to the sprinkler system.
specialEventWriteUp.paragraph5: Spaces fee donations are NON-REFUNDABLE. Your fee is a donation to the MUMC Men's Club, which distributes the collected fees to deserving local charities.

specialEventBanner.infoSection1: As always, the weekly market season will open on the first Saturday in May. But for those who just can't wait, in March we'll repeat last year's very popular pre-season event: the second annual
specialEventBanner.infoSection2: It might still be a little early then for some of the veggies, but all your favorite vendors from the
specialEventBanner.infoSection3: will be on hand, with arts and crafts, fine woodworking, fabric items, baked goods, pickles, jams, jellies, and much, much more! No reservation required. Vendor fees* will be $15, which will go to local charities.
specialEventBanner.comment: (*As always, charitable groups and kids under 13 are free.)
specialEventBanner.whenIsIt: Mark your calendars for Saturday, June 20th, from 11:00 - 3:00.

parking.paragraph1: The parking lot adjacent to the market field is intended for the use of our customers.  After setting up, vendors may park in either of the church parking lots across the street (feel free to park in any of the handicapped spaces; the handicap restrictions apply only to parking on Sundays.) You may also angle park along the treeline on the right side of Warm Springs Road, past the market field.
parking.paragraph2: Please DO NOT park on the grassy road sides alongside the market field; doing so blocks the view of the market, and creates a safety hazard for visitors walking onto the field.

reservation.termOfServices: IN RESERVING A SPACE, I AGREE TO HOLD MIDLAND UNITED METHODIST CHURCH AND THE MIDLAND COMMUNITY FARMERS MARKET HARMLESS FROM ALL CLAIMS OR SUITS FOR ALL LOSSES, LIABILITIES, INJURIES, OR OTHER DETRIMENTS WHICH MAY BE MADE AGAINST MIDLAND UNITED METHODIST CHURCH OR THE MIDLAND COMMUNITY FARMERS MARKET BASED ON ANY INTENTIONAL OR NEGLIGENT ACT OR OMISSION BY THE VENDOR OR A CUSTOMER AS A RESULT OF PARTICIPATION IN THE MIDLAND COMMUNITY FARMERS MARKETS.
